author: Michael Larabel
description: It's unfortunate the number of significant Linux engineering losses at Intel this year. Beyond the staffing reductions throughout the company, seeing the loss of Linux engineering talent and many of their open-source contributors outside of kernel space too has been especially hard hitting to see. Intel for years has been very well regarded for their prolific open-source contributions and typically leading early hardware enablement within the Linux kernel, compiler toolchains, and related components. There's another hit to the Intel Linux team with one of their USB4/Thunderbolt maintainers departing the company...
title: Intel Loses One Of Its USB4 / Thunderbolt Linux Driver Maintainers

author: Michael Larabel
description: The input subsystem fixes for the week were sent out on Saturday ahead of the Linux 6.17-rc6 kernel due out later today. Notable with this batch of "fixes" is enabling support for the high-end FLYDIGI APEX 5 gaming controller...
title: FLYDIGI APEX 5 Controller Support Landing In Linux 6.17

author: Michael Larabel
description: Adding to the list of feature caveats around the different Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite laptops and the varying Linux state is video acceleration support. But patches were posted this week by a Linaro engineer enabling hardware accelerated video playback for two X Elite laptop models...
title: Select Qualcomm X Elite Laptops Seeing IRIS Video Acceleration On Linux

author: Michael Larabel
description: The Samsung Exynos 7870 Octa SoC released back in 2016 on a 14nm process and powered by eight Arm Cortex-53 cores and a Mali T830 GPU.  Finally now for late 2025 there is open-source display driver happenings going mainline for this aging SoC...
title: Samsung Exynos 7870 Seeing New Open-Source Driver Activity For Linux 6.18
